container-type.name: container-type
container-type.computedValue: the keyword normal or one or more of size, inline-size

container-name.name: container-name
container-name.computedValue: the keyword none, or an ordered list of identifiers

<size-feature>.prose: A container size query allows querying the size of the query containerâ€™s principal box. It is a boolean combination of individual size features (<size-feature>) that each query a single, specific dimensional feature of the query container. The syntax of a <size-feature> is the same as for a media feature: a feature name, a comparator, and a value. [mediaqueries-5] The boolean syntax and logic combining size features into a size query is the same as for CSS feature queries. (See @supports. [CSS-CONDITIONAL-3])

<style-feature>.prose: A container style query allows querying the computed values of the query container. It is a boolean combination of individual style features (<style-feature>) that each query a single, specific property of the query container. The syntax of a <style-feature> is the same as for a declaration [CSS-SYNTAX-3], and its query is true if the computed value of the given property on the query container matches the given value (which is also computed with respect to the query container), unknown if the property or its value is invalid or unsupported, and false otherwise. The boolean syntax and logic combining style features into a style query is the same as for CSS feature queries. (See @supports. [CSS-CONDITIONAL-3])
